au.com.agic.apptesting.steps

Class ProxyStepDefinitions

  • java.lang.Object
    • au.com.agic.apptesting.steps.ProxyStepDefinitions

  • @Component
public class ProxyStepDefinitions
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains Gherkin step definitions relating to the use of the embedded BrowserMob proxy. These steps have Atom snipptets that start with the prefix "block" and "delete". See https://github.com/mcasperson/iridium-snippets for more details.

    • Method Detail

      • enableHar

        @When(value="^I enable HAR logging$")
public void enableHar()
        EWnable HAR logging

      • saveHarFile

        @When(value="^I dump the HAR file(?: to( alias)? \"(.*?)\")?$")
public void saveHarFile(java.lang.String alias,
                                                                                        java.lang.String filename)
        Saves a HAR file with the details of the transactions that have passed through BrowserMob. This step is only required if you wish to save har files at particular points during the test. The HAR file is always saved when browsermob is shut down, meaning that once you begin the capture of the HAR file it will be saved regardless of the success or failure of the test.
        Parameters:
        alias - If this word is found in the step, it means the filename is found from the data set.
        filename - The optional filename to use for the HAR file

      • blockUrl

        @When(value="^I block access to the URL regex \"(.*?)\" with response \"(\\d+)\"$")
public void blockUrl(java.lang.String url,
                                                                                                         java.lang.Integer response)
        Block access to all urls that match the regex
        Parameters:
        url - A regular expression that matches URLs to be blocked
        response - The response code to send back when a matching URL is accessed

      • blockUrl

        @When(value="^I block access to the URL regex \"(.*?)\" of the type \"(.*?)\" with response \"(\\d+)\"$")
public void blockUrl(java.lang.String url,
                                                                                                                               java.lang.String type,
                                                                                                                               java.lang.Integer response)
        Block access to all urls that match the regex
        Parameters:
        url - A regular expression that matches URLs to be blocked
        response - The response code to send back when a matching URL is accessed
        type - The http type of request to block (CONNECT, GET, PUT etc)

      • enableWhitelist

        @When(value="^I enable the whitelist with responding with \"(\\d+)\" for unmatched requests$")
public void enableWhitelist(java.lang.Integer response)
        Allow access to all urls that match the regex
        Parameters:
        response - The response code for all whitelisted urls

      • allowUrl

        @When(value="^I allow access to the URL regex \"(.*?)\"$")
public void allowUrl(java.lang.String url)
        Allow access to all urls that match the regex
        Parameters:
        url - A regular expression that matches URLs to be allowed

      • stripHeaders

        @When(value="^I (?:remove|delete) root AWSELB cookie from the request to the URL regex \"(.*?)\"$")
public void stripHeaders(java.lang.String url)
        Apps like life express will often include AWSELB cookies from both the root "/" context and the application "/life-express" context. Supplying both cookies means that requests are sent to a EC2 instance that didn't generate the initial session, and so the request fails. This step allows us to remove these duplicated cookies from the request.
        Parameters:
        url - The regex that matches URLs that should have duplicate AWSELB cookies removed

      • changeHeader

        @When(value="^I set header \"([^\"]*)\" with value \"([^\"]*)\"$")
public void changeHeader(java.lang.String headerName,
                                                                                            java.lang.String headerValue)
        Set new or modify an existing HTTP header
        Parameters:
        headerName - HTTP header name
        headerValue - HTTP header value

      • removeHeader

        Parameters:
        headerName - HTTP header name
